tp:treatment-sec.p:
Clivotirolites decoratus Korn & Hairapetian
gen. et sp. nov. , Baghuk Mountain.

Representatives of the family Dzhulfitidae with large conch; maximum adult diameters are about 120 mm . Adult stage with trapezoidal whorl profile. Subadult stage with conical ventrolateral nodes, adult stage with weak ribs. Suture line protracted on the flanks, with deep external lobe; depths of external lobe and adventive lobe nearly identical.

From the Latin ‘ clivus ’, meaning ‘oblique’, because of the suture line and the similarity with
Tirolites
and
Paratirolites
.

Clivotirolites decoratus Korn & Hairapetian
gen. et sp. nov. ;
Clivotirolites petilus Korn & Hairapetian
gen. et sp. nov.

Clivotirolites
gen. nov. differs from
Paratirolites
and related genera in the oblique protracting outline of the outer suture line.
